questions.text: A circle C of radius 2 lies in the second quadrant and touches both the coordinate axes. Let r be the radius of a circle that has centre at the point (2, 5) and intersects the circle C at exactly two points. If the set of all possible values of r is the interval (, ), then 3 – 2 is equal to : (1) 15 (2) 14 (3) 12 (4) 10
